description: Asynchronous functions with promises, callbacks, and async patterns

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="fetchUserData" async="true">
  <q:param name="userId" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    FETCH https://api.example.com/users/{userId}
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Returns promise that resolves with user data

input.natural_language: Fetch user and their posts in parallel

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="getUserWithPosts" async="true">
  <q:param name="userId" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    PARALLEL {
      user: FETCH https://api.example.com/users/{userId},
      posts: FETCH https://api.example.com/users/{userId}/posts
    }
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Executes both fetches in parallel, returns combined result

input.natural_language: Fetch user, then fetch their permissions

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="getUserPermissions" async="true">
  <q:param name="userId" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    AWAIT user = FETCH https://api.example.com/users/{userId}
    AWAIT permissions = FETCH https://api.example.com/permissions/{user.roleId}
    RETURN {user, permissions}
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Fetches user first, then uses result to fetch permissions

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="fetchWithFallback" async="true">
  <q:param name="id" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    TRY {
      FETCH https://api.example.com/data/{id}
    } CATCH {
      FETCH https://backup-api.example.com/data/{id}
    }
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Tries primary API, falls back to backup on error

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="fetchWithTimeout" async="true" timeout="5000">
  <q:param name="url" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    FETCH {url}
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Aborts request after 5 seconds if not completed
